short_description: With its ancient mud-brick architecture and bustling markets, Mali is a traveler's dream come true. Experience the magic of the Sahara in Timbuktu and explore the vibrant culture of Bamako. Don't miss the Dogon Country, a UNESCO World Heritage Site known for its fascinating cliff villages and unique rock art

weather.title: Mali has a subtropical to arid climate with hot temperatures year-round. It experiences a dry season from November to April, with little to no rainfall, and a wet season from May to October, characterized by sporadic rainfall and higher humidity

when_to_visit.title: Sightseeing
when_to_visit.short_description: Particularly popular with tourists due to cooler temperatures and comfortable weather to enjoy outdoor activities

when_to_visit.title: Dry season
when_to_visit.short_description: Lower humidity, and minimal rainfall, creating ideal conditions for exploring the country

when_to_visit.title: Wet season
when_to_visit.short_description: Higher temperatures, increased humidity, and occasional heavy rains. Visiting in the wet season can have its own unique charm but be prepared for unpredictable weather conditions

weather.best_time: The best time to visit Mali is during the dry season from November to February when the weather is cooler, and you can explore the country's historical sites, such as Timbuktu and the Dogon Country, comfortably
